description:
Story Titles

  • U*NA*GI by Yuzu
  • The Perfect Recipe by Lindsay Cibos & Jared Hodges
  • Melinda by Shelton Bryant
  • Class of '01 by L0cke
name: U*NA*GI; The Perfect Recipe; Melinda; Class of '01

description: Hawkman takes the offensive with a vengeance as the Absorbascon infiltrates humanity's psyche!
name: My Worlds Opposed

description: Back in their own dimension, the crew must face the ramifications of their actions in "Homecoming..."
name: Homecoming...

description:
1. Cover by Paris Cullins and Al Williamson.
  2. "The Sleepwalker from Krypton" written by Craig Boldman, penciled by Curt Swan, inked by Al Williamson, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Gaspar.
  3. "One Life too Many" written by Randy Stradley, penciled by Kurt Schaffenberger, inked by Dave Hunt, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Milt Snapinn.
name: The Sleepwalker from Krypton / One Life too Many

description: Frustrated and seeking revenge, Changeling confronts Deathstroke for a battle to the death! However, when Slade Wilson refuses to fight back, will Gar choose forgiveness or vengeance?
name: Shades of Gray!

deck: The year is 2032. Corruption, prostitution, and cameras are everywhere; from the top of what's left of the American government to the bottom of the sleaziest pit imaginable. When former vid star Reuben Flagg is drafted into the Plexus Rangers, he's sent to Chicago, a cesspool of gang violence, dirty politics and urban warfare. It's enough to crush an ordinary man but Reuben is a survivor and with the help of his new friends, he just might be the man to put it all back together.
description:
Cyril goes for his last cycle ride. Reuben and Amanda take apart Stagolee DeLyons' operation, and Stag is killed trying to escape the Rangers and revealed to be not what he appeared. Back at the Plexmall, Chicago has spoken and the new mayor will be... Raul?

This issue also contains an 8 page backup story: Machineries of Joy by Alan Moore and Larry Stroman.
name: Bullets and Ballots! Conclusion

description: An in-depth look into Badger's mulitple personalities. Ham uses Jim as a livestock vendor for his sacrifices. Badger goes nuts and gets commited.
name: Surfin' USA!
Charnel House

description:
The free heads take over Ylum's sister moon and begin terraforming it into Headworld. During their building, they discover ancient ruins that mirror those found on Ylum. Nexus consults Dr. Xyp who claims he can implant a device in Nexus' skull that will block his dreams. Meanwhile, the heads open up diplomatic negotiations with Ylum. Little do they know they are being observed by Clausius.

4 page Dave backup story: Tales Of Dave, by Baron and Willingham
name: Talking Heads

description: Alpha Flight travels to the land of the Great Beasts to destroy them. They are able to defeat their foes as well as save the life of Walter Langowski by transferring his soul into the mechanical Box until they can figure something more permanent for him.
name: Final Conflict

description:
The Toad, one of the original members of the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants, is back! He, Frog-Man, and Spider-Kid take on Spidey in one off-beat story!

Spider-Man saves the evil mutant Toad's life and Toady decides to repay the favour by becoming Spidey's new partner. But just when our hero tries to dump Toad like yesterday's trash, Frogman vie for the sidekick position.
name: Jump For My Love, or Spring is in the Air

description: His name is Terminus, and he's the worst planet-wrecker since Galactus! How can the Avengers defeat a creature so strong he makes Hercules look like a 98-pound weakling (and a midget, to boot)?!
name: Holocaust in a Hidden Land

description:
Who is Captain America? A better question is who is Steve Rogers? Introducing this issue: The Maniacal Menace of Madcap! Plus: A Dramatic look back at the Invaders of World War II.

Captain America returns from Great Britain. Nomad gets a day-job. Chaos reigns on the streets of New York as Madcap makes his comic debut.

The begining of Mark Gruenwald's illustrious run as head writer for the series. He would continue in this role for 10 years.
name: Stop Making Sense

description:
Learn the history of Cloak and Dagger! In their first issue, the duo takes down a human trafficking ring at a pornography shop. And Dagger visits her birth mother!

In this issue Cloak and Dagger storm a porn shop that employs children. Afterwards they seek shelter in a church, but in a fit of rage Cloak attacks the perishiners as sinners, swallowing them in his Cloak. Then Dagger decides to leaves their duo and look for her mother.
name: Sinners All

description:
Heather Glenn meets a tragic end, leaving Matt wracked in guilt. But was Heather's death truly a suicide‚Ä¶or a murder with a motive? Murdock & Nelson are back in practice, trying to avenge the death of a woman who touched both their lives.

Heather Glenn keeps calling Matt after they broke up (arranged by Black Widow and Foggy). She says to Matt she is going to die if he wouldn't come back to her but he stop answering her calls. Then she commits suicide.

Matt senses a strange smell of cigarette inside her house and investigates, just to know that an Italian stolen her thinks from the safe, but she was already dead.
name: Fog

description:
In New Mexico desert a motorcycle with a couple riding it runs towards a barricade made by the US army. They jump over the troops with incredible skills.

In Angel's Aerie, base of the Defenders, US troops are removing Angel and Cloud, both of them severely injured during last issue's battle. Moondragon and Valkyrie are apparently dead.

Candy Southern shows up and tells the general she is the leader of the Defenders and that he can to talk to her about anything. Suddenly a soldier appears shouting that some motorcyclist had just passed from their barricade and is coming to them.

Later, in NY, the mysterious injured jogger from last issue, Andrea, is having a fling with her good Samaritan, Tony--and also cloning his credit cards.

Back to the Defenders, Beast is trying to cure Cloud, but he doesn't know what she really is or anything about her physiology; outside experts point out that her organs don't work the way humans' do. Suddenly the alarm goes on, because the motorcyclist has reached their home. It is actually Johnny Blaze, the Ghost Rider, and his wife Roxanne. They manage to make it through the Defenders' defenses and illusions (Dr. Strange, Captain America, Hulk, Namor and Wolverine) and finally reach the Aerie along with the others. The couple say they saw some of the strange events caused by the slime monster and wanted to help out their friends.

Suddenly the power goes down and the alarm goes off, and someone breaks into the medical center. When the lights comes back it is actually Valkyrie, alive!

Val tells everyone that Moondragon is also still alive, but little about Heather Douglas still remains in Moondragon, who has now only anger, pain and madness inside her mind. Then Valkyrie says Odin took her special powers away now that the Dragon of the Moon was defeated and separated from Moondragon; now she is just herself again. Angel awakens but is still blinded. We see that Moondragon is now living in disguise elsewhere in the world.

Later that night the Defenders have a meeting to discuss about their situation: are they really are a group of super heroes, or a bunch of amateurs? Gargoyle thinks they should join the Avengers, Angel says they had paid a price too high, but Candy replies saying they have been fighting bad guys, aliens and robots for years and they are good at it. Valkyrie agrees and Beast tells Iceman that they will make it work.

Some days later, Johnny Blaze enters Angel's room and says that he had thought about his offer to join the team, but he has to turn it down it, he doesn't want to go back to a super hero team, even to be just a mechanic. Then he congratulates the Defenders on what they have been doing. Finally Roxanne asks for some money to Warren. Of course Angel loans Johnny some money, and the couple goes away happy.

Back at the medical center, Beast is thinking about the end of the Defenders, when some woman sneaks in and looks at Cloud. She is actually Nancy, a girl from the US army who says she once went out with Beast. When Beast leaves the room, Nancy stays looking at Cloud, and then picks up an old newspaper with a picture of Carol Faber, 17, who nearly died in a car accident. She looks just like Cloud.

The "Five Women" of the title presumably refers to Cloud, "Andrea" (later revealed to be Andromeda), Candy, Moondragon, and Valkyrie, although one of them could be "Nancy," later revealed to be Seraph.
name: Five Women

description: She-Hulk must battle Malice, but what will Jen tell her teammates when she discovers the evil-doer‚Äôs true identity?
name: "Tell them all they love must die... "

description: ¬†Marc is trying to find Marlene, to talk to her and try to right their relationship.¬† He's still hearing the voices in his head giving him instructions on what Konshu wants his Knight of Vengeance to do for him.¬† He's off to the Yucatan to stop an evil doctor from performing pain threshold test on innocent people.
name: Deadly Knowledge

volume.name: The Further Adventures of Indiana Jones

description:
At the Christians family manor, in Christiansboro, Virginia, the Gargoyle comes face-to-face with the impossible. The Gargoyle confronts himself, or rather his human self, Isaac Christians, along with the love of his life, the long dead Elaine Willoughby. The Gargoyle curbs his violent nature, upon seeing how much it frightens Willoughby. Christians taunts the Gargoyle by cavorting with a host of lustful harlots, reminding the Gargoyle of his own wanton past. Christians reveals the nature of the harlots, as well as the unspeakable pleasures he has experienced, since inhabiting the Gargoyle's human form. Christians reveals his own nature. Christians speaks of a more mythological world, before the rise of Christianity.

The old Gods died. The spirits of the Earth and Air became stone. Churches were built on the places that once served as worship for the old Gods. One such church was built over a hot spot for mystic energy, which permeated the entire structure, reawakening the spirits within the church's multitude of gargoyles. These sprits would have remained aware, but unmoving, as lifeless stone, had it not been for the coming of a powerful sorcerer. In retribution for the loss of the old world, the sorcerer returned motion to the gargoyles, and set them upon the land. Their wanton assault upon the innocent, however, instilled feelings of remorse in the sorcerer, who returned the gargoyles to unmoving stone. Some of the gargoyles, had become too powerful, and thus could not be restrained anew

They wandered the world, becoming the stuff of legends. One gargoyle, in particular, became the slave of an insane magician, spending years in servitude, until finally rising up to slay it's master. For centuries after, it lived in the shadows, preying upon the innocent. This gargoyle burned with the desires of the flesh, but, as a creature of stone, could never truly experience those pleasures. It became a creature worshipped by man, bringing it to the attention of the demonic cabal, the Six-Fingered Hand. Enslaved again, this gargoyle rebelled, and was punished for it's transgressions, just as the demons also punished Christians The Gargoyle realizes that the spirit inhabiting his human body, is the same one that was expunged from the Gargoyle body now inhabited by Christians' spirit.

"Christians" reveals the further horrors he has committed in the old man's body. Sharing Christians memories, the spirit of the gargoyle is privy to all of the Gargoyle's secret sins. The Gargoyle reflects on a time, shortly after Word War I, when he, as Christians, lived in Paris. Christians sought to fill the emptiness in his heart in the arms of prostitutes. Christians fell madly in love with one such prostitute, Germaine. Christians became more debauched, desperate to hold onto Germaine's fleeting affections. Ultimately, it was all for naught. Germaine abandoned Christians. The Gargoyle flees the memories of how far he had fallen as a man. The Gargoyle is attacked by the other living gargoyles. The Gargoyle is defeated. Willoughby begs the Gargoyle to protect her.

"Christians" offers to switch spirits with the Gargoyle, returning their spirits to their rightful bodies. Willoughby pleads with the Gargoyle to consent to "Christians" proposal, so that they can be together again. Against his better judgment the Gargoyle consents to the transference of souls. The spirit of the gargoyle returns to the Gargoyle's body, as Christians spirit regains his humanity. Leading the other gargoyles, the Gargoyle takes flight, and vanishes into the night sky. "Willoughby" strikes Christians, berating him for being a fool. Though the body is that of Willoughby, the spirit animating it is Germaine. Germane laughs at Christian's plight. Unbeknownst to them, the sorcerer, the very one who originally gave life to the gargoyles, draws near.
name: Burning Bright: The Gargoyle's Tale

description: The three facets of Hulk‚Äôs personality try desperately to lead our hero to a better and safer place. But will Hulk listen to the Triad or follow his own path?
name: The Triad!

description: How can Tony Stark defeat Dr. Demonicus when the doctor is wearing the Iron Man armor?
name: The Omnos

description: ¬† Reprints Spider-Man # 38.

Moonshadow's narration of his early life begins with a quote from Yeats.

He tells of how he was locked in Jobidiah Unkshuss's Home for Miscreants and Madmen, where he meets an alien claiming to be King Macha, lord of the interstellar empire they are in. Moon sees a vision of his alien G'L-Doses father, who simply watches and does not rescue him. However, Ira, who got him locked up in the first place, breaks Moon out after realizing Moon put their ship in hock and he can't escape in it without Moon's help.

While Moon is overjoyed at seeing Ira, who he sees as a father figure, Ira just wants to use him. He puts Moon to work in menial jobs to make enough money to get the ship back, but boozes all the cash away. He then forces Moon to steal a famous giant egg in an attempt to get the money. Moon rebels, as his mother taught him stealing was very wrong, based on an event in her own youth. Ira's will prevails, however, and they go through with the crime. When they are almost caught, Ira knocks Moon out and runs off, leaving Moon despairing from the betrayal.

Moon has a vision of his mad Aunt Ettie, who flies him over the city and tempts him with the bliss of insanity. Moon rejects it for the pain of reality, and finds Ira, whereupon they are both caught by the police.
name: The Crying of the Wind

description:
The Power kids return to the sewers to find their missing schoolbooks (issue #11). They have the rescued kitten with them; their mother is allergic and they can't keep it.

When they enter the sewers, they are almost immediately brought down by the Morlocks, who have been waiting for them to return. They explain that they know all about the Powers from their schoolbooks. The Morlocks plan to erase the children's memories and keep them in the sewers forever so AnnaLee, another Morlock who has recently lost her own children, can adopt them. AnnaLee is an empath who projects her feelings to those around her. As a result, she is forced to stay with Leech, a young mutant who disables others' powers, to keep her ability under control. Since Leech is close by at all time, the Power kids cannot use their abilities to escape.

Kitty Pryde and Nightcrawler, who are visiting the Morlocks, catch a glimpse of the Powers being transported through the underground. They follow and discover that the children are not Morlocks, and have been kidnapped.

Julie takes the kitten - which has found a home with Leech - and flies off with it into the sewers to draw Leech away from the battle. Leech explains AnnaLee's story, including the loss of her children. Julie returns to the battle and reveals the story to everyone else. She tells AnnaLee that she is sorry for the loss of her kids, but that they really have to return to their parents. With the help of the two X-Men, they extract a promise that the Morlocks will leave them alone. They give the kitten to Leech so he will have a friend, and they return to their own home.

However, the last panel of the issue indicates that AnnaLee will not be keeping her promise to stay away - she is shown standing outside Power Pack's apartment building.

** Storyline concludes in Uncanny X-Men #195**

Guest stars: Kitty Pryde, Nightcrawler, AnnaLee, Leech, Morlocks
name: Underground

description: Rom becomes caught in the middle of two warring factions. Humans on one side and machines on the other with neither willing to give an inch. Rom, being a cyborg, is trapped between man and machine...which side will he choose?
Luke, Kiro and Dani the Zeltron must fight alone against an army of Nagai invading a remote planet! This issue, a major character dies‚Äîcould it be Luke's last stand?
name: Escape

description: A good old light-hearted tale where everyone has fun -- everyone but Ben! He's up to his ears in leprechauns! They've granted him three wishes -- but there's a big difference between what he wants and what he gets!
name: Legends
A New Deal From an Old Deck

description:
When the Power Pack's parents have their minds erased, Kitty Pryde gathers the X-Men together to set things right for the super-powered siblings!

* Crossover with Power Pack #12*

The four super-powered siblings of Power Pack- Alex, Julie, Jack and Katie- awake in the middle of the night to discover that their parents don't know who they are. Not only that, but their belongings, down to their favorite breakfast cereals, have been removed from their apartment.

The kids flee the apartment and descend into the sewers, where they are apprehended by the Morlocks. The Morlocks previously attempted to kidnap Power Pack so they could be adopted by AnnaLee, a mutant who recently lost her own children; they're not giving up.

Only five-year-old Katie is able to escape from the Morlocks, although her face is horribly deformed by Masque. She runs into the subway tunnels, where she is frightened by a passing train. A police officer discovers her, but since she is scared and unable to see in the dark, she hits him with a power ball. Katie is subdued and brought to Bellevue Hospital. She refuses to speak or identify herself.

The next morning, Kitty Pryde sees Katie's photo on the news. She assembles a small team of X-Men - Wolverine, Rachel, and Rogue - to rescue Katie from the hospital, and gives Katie a special jacket to make her an honorary X-Man.

The X-Men and Katie enter the Morlocks' territory. They discover that the Power siblings' rooms have been reassembled in the sewers, and that the other three children have been disfigured by Masque and have had their memories erased by the Morlock, Beautiful Drreamer. They now believe that the empath Morlock AnnaLee is their mother, and they immediately attack the X-Men. In the midst of the battle, Julie grabs Katie and takes her to have her memories erased. Kitty Pryde follows and attempts to reason with AnnaLee to let Katie go, to no avail.

Callisto finally appears and orders the Morlocks to release Power Pack, restore their memories and faces, and put everything right at home. She admonishes the Morlocks to consider Power Pack to be completely off-limits, like the X-Men, and threatens AnnaLee with death in the ring if she disobeys.
name: It Was a Dark and Stormy Night...!

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
We start with Spidey hidden in a warehouse waiting to surprise some crooks. He beats a load of people up in standard fashion before clinging to the top of an escaping van. As he tries to deal with the villains inside, it crashes and he gets some verbals from upset drivers.

Cut to the Bugle and Pete's trying to sell the pics of his latest victory to Robbie. He's having none of it though, saying his pics are very samey and not original (hmm, maybe something for the writer of the issue thus far there).

Jonah has a look at the pics for his new project, which turns out to be 'Now' magazine, which will include lots of photojournalism showing up Spidey to be the pest that he is. JJJ also turns down Pete's photos as they show Spidey in a good light.

Next we cut to a scene of Doc Ock getting psychiatric treatment. The psychiatric Doctor is telling Ock how well he's coming along. Ock goes back to his room and goes to sleep. He is awoken though and, looking up at the ceiling, he sees...

SHOCK HORROR

A Spider's Web.

He has a flashback to spectacular 79 (a pretty good issue) where Spidey beat him and gave a cool speech about how Ock would never beat him.

As Ock starts having some sort of panic attack, his arms, which are under lock and key across town, spring to life. Ock's psyche is going haywire so his arms begin their journey back to him.

As Ock regains his arms (but not consciousness) Spidey rushes to save the day. He is left holding up a building with a pretty awesome show of strength while Ock escapes.

Our final scene is of Ock debating with himself about whether or not he should go back to a life of crime or not. His choice: the death of Spider-Man.
name: Arms and the Man!

description:
Classic reprints from British anthology comic 2000AD.

Cover: Brian Bolland (the stars of 2000AD)

  • D.R. and Quinch - Get Drafted (parts 2-3) (progs 356-357) (Alan Moore - Alan Davis)
  • Judge Dredd - The Invisible Man (progs 134-135) (John Wagner - Ron Smith)
  • Strontium Dog - The Schicklegruber Grab (parts 3-4) (progs 184-185) (Alan Grant - Carlos Ezquerra)
name: 2000AD Monthly 4

description:
Cannonball burst through the walls of Westchester County Airport carrying Magik. Both of them were wearing nothing but their swimsuits. Cannonball ran outside, barefoot in the snow and was nearly run over by the red van he'd been chasing. He flew through the van and dragged the driver out, but dumped him on the ground before flying into the air in pursuit of the plane that had just taken off. However, the pilot caused one of the jets to blast fire out at Cannonball, which distracted him enough to cause him to fall. Magik caught him in one of her stepping discs, and teleported him to Limbo. There she handed over the rogue driver to Sym for interrogation. The driver soon confessed that their friends were to be taken to fight as Gladiators in Los Angeles. Magik was sure that she could control her teleportation stepping discs so that they would arrive before the plane landed. However, just like when they were in the Massachusetts Academy (see New Mutants # 17) Magik transported them through time as well as space; they arrived a week later.

Cannonball flew them both to Lila Cheney's Los Aangeles beach house where Guido, her butler & bodyguard, refused them entry until Cannonball identified himself. Lila threw herself into Cannonball's arms and then transported them to her Dyson sphere. However, she didn't realise that she'd also teleported her new backing singer, Alison Blaire. Dazzler hadn't revealed her mutant identity for fear of losing work. She overheard Cannonball's problem with the Gladiators and told them what she remembered from working with them before. She offered to help, but Lila was suspicious of Dazzler's addiction to the spotlight. Lila then had Guido arrange tickets for that night's Gladiators show.

Somewhere in LA, Sunspot demanded to see Magma. He had been dressed in a partially armoured outfit, similar to that he'd worn in the Nova Roma arena (see New Mutants #9). Suddenly the door smashed in and he was attacked by Axe. However, Axe dodged Sunspot's attacks and held him in a choke hold while a holographic projection of a man called Alexander Flynn explained the situation. Sunspot was still unreceptive until Magma arrived (also wearing a skimpy suit of armour). She explained that innocent homeless children were being held hostage. If Sunspot & Magma refused to fight, then the kidnapped children would take their place in the arena. They couldn't see any other way out of the situation and were therefore forced to agree to fight.

On the alien island in the Bermuda Triangle, Magneto nearly collapsed as he used his magnetic powers to raise a fallen alien statue. Lee Forester caught him from behind, and apologised for her behaviour before (see the previous issue). They reconciled with a kiss, but were soon interrupted by a pained telepathic message from Professor Xavier. He implored Magneto to lead the X-Men in battle against the Beyonder. Magneto was then left to explain the situation to Lee in more detail.

Back in LA, Lila, Dazzler and the two New Mutants arrived at the gladiatorial arena. The owner was thrilled to see that Dazzler had returned, and delighted to identify Cannonball. Once seated Lila compared Dazzler to an ex-junkie who was holding a bag of pure heroin. Magik enquired as to what their plan of action was, and Cannonball just suggested that they grab the others and use Lila's power to teleport out of their as soon as possible.

The battle begun and Dazzler immediately jumped into the arena to help her friend Ivich. Across the arena Sunspot & Magma struggled to hold their own, and were thrown off by Dazzler's light show. Suddenly, the roof of the arena lifted up and Magneto demanded that the mutants accompany him to fight the Beyonder. However, Sunspot & Magma refused to leave, forcing Cannonball and the others to go with Magneto.

Note: The events of Secret Wars II # 1 directly precede the events of New Mutants # 30.
name: Meanwhile, Back At The Mansion

description:
The original US reprint series from Eagle Comics reprinting the best Judge Dredd stories from UK anthology comic 2000AD.

Cover: Brian Bolland (The Apocalypse War)

  • The Apocalypse War (parts 6-10) (progs 250-254) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Carlos Ezquerra)
name: Judge Dredd 21

description:
Contents and Publishing details

This issue contains the third Stan Sakai Usagi Yojimbo story, "Lone Rabbit and Child - Part II", as well as part four of " Erma Felna, EDF" by Steve Gallacci. Only 6,000 copies of this issue were printed.

Reprints of the stories

The Usagi story was reprinted in the Usagi Yojimbo: Summer Special and in the Usagi Yojimbo TPB #1: The Ronin. Steve Gallacci's "Erma Felna, EDF part 4" was reprinted in Gallacci's Command Review volume.

Plot of "Lone Rabbit and Child - Part II"

After discovering Tomoe's body limp along the riverside, Usagi and Lord Noriyuki find that she is alive, but in bad shape. The young lord must decide if they will take her to town to recover, or stay in hiding and watch her die. Such is the weight of leadership. Not considering his own safety, Noriyuki decides to help her recover at an inn in a small village. Several days later, Tomoe awakes and is horrified that her lord has been placed in danger on her behalf. She scolds Usagi, but Lord Noriyuki stands firm by his decision. He is the Lord after all. After seeing her through the worst of her recovery, Usagi and Noriyuki plan to depart, leaving Tomoe to rest.

Dressed as peasants, the two leave the small town. On a bridge, the two are attacked by Shinobi of the Neko Ninja Clan. Usagi valiantly fights them down to the last ninja, who temporarily blinds Usagi with dust. Seeing the danger to his bodyguard and himself, the young Lord slays the last ninja saving them both. Shortly after, two samurai on horseback approach. They are retainers sent from Lord Noriyuki's mansion to help escort him safely home.

A week later, at Lord Noriyuki's mansion, Tomoe returns. She asks after the long eared ronin who had helped them, but is told he had left as soon as the young lord was safe. Meanwhile, Lord Hebi reports to his master Lord Hikiji that their plans to kill Noriyuki have failed. A ronin by the name of Miyamoto Usagi interfered and brought the child safely home. This is one of the few appearances of Hikiji, and we learn he is a human, with a scar above his eye very similar to Usagi's...
name: Albedo Anthropomorphics #4

description: A fight to the death between the Hawks and Thanagar as this explosive limited series concludes!
name: No Sound Of Clashing Wars

description:
A medieval battle ensues between Merlin and Doctor Fate.

The Shining Knight investigates a mysterious structure, which has appeared where once stood Camelot. Inside, the Shining Knight encounters an armored, medieval knight, who attacks him. The Shining Knight strikes the knight down, revealing the knight to be King Arthur. The Shining Knight is overjoyed to see his liege-lord, and immediately swears fealty to Arthur. The Shining Knight is struck down by Arthur. The All-Star Squadron, en route to London, are caught in another German air raid on the city. Before the All-Star Squadron can take action, the Blackhawk Squadron engages the German Luftwaffe.

Doctor Fate, the Firebrand, and Robotman join the Blackhawk Squadron in repelling the Luftwaffe. Unable to fly, the Hourman is forced to stay behind, a fact that doesn't sit well with the Man Of The Hour. After defeating the Luftwaffe, the All-Star Squadron is officially introduced to the Blackhawk Squadron. The Prime MInister of Great Britain, Winston Churchill, arrives, to brief the two groups. Churchill reveals that the Shining Knight was sent to investigate a communications blackout, in the Southern region of England.

Since then, not only has the Shining Knight disappeared, but the lost area of contact has grown. Blackhawk joins the All-Star Squadron in investigating the phenomena. Upon reaching their destination, the All-Star Squadron discover Camelot, in all it's glory, sprawled out before them. The wizard, Merlin, blasts the Blackhawk out of the sky. The Firebrand, and Robotman, are struck down next. Doctor Fate battles Merlin. After an epic mystic battle, Doctor Fate manages to get close enough to, literally, knock Merlin's head off. Merlin, revealed to be a robot, explodes.

King Arthur reveals himself to be Doctor Fate's nemesis, Wotan. Rather than exact his vengeance upon Doctor Fate personally, Wotan tasks the Shining Knight with slaying Doctor Fate.

Golden Age Gallery--Three pin-ups, one of Doctor Mid-Nite, one of Wonder Woman, and one of the Green Lantern, and his "sidekick", Doiby Dickles, illustrated by Mike Clark, and embellished by Jerry Acerno.
name: Camelot 1942!

description:
This book starts off brilliantly. Discussing the lost characters of Earths past in the DCU. Actually, these little vignettes are spread through out the book, as it ends up being a series of one page gags.

And at the end of the book, we are promised a showdown with Darkseid.
name: The Ambush Bug History of the DC Universe

description:
On the Gemworld, Amy and her allies are preparing for what could be the last battle against¬†Fire Jade. Who will prevail? If Fire Jade managed to kill Citrina, everyone could disappear forever in the Gemworld.¬†
This issue we start with Amethyst talking to everyone and the revelation thatFire jadeis really and might be Lady Emerald.. This makes all the rulers of Gemworld to ponder how and why.Some say it was due to Citrina's weakening condition that the magic fabric grew fragile¬† It is also revealed that if Citrina dies so will the Gemworld since she created it from bits of magic from many other realms.¬†
Just then Fire Jade attacks.The battle of all battles takes place . Fire Jade is trying to tear Gemworld asunder and recreate it her way just like Citrina did so that she may live forever.Fire Jade brings up emeralds and in turn they are her allies from the Twilight Realm "twixt life and death" (not those stupid vampire , werewolf movies either thank god but these creatures do sparkle, lol).¬†
Back on earth The Winstons (Amethyst's earth adoptive parents and Lady Emeralds sister princess Emerald show Tom afriend of Amy why she is sleeping and reveal who she is and the Gemworld and who Emmy really is.¬†
In Gemworld our heroes are battling the wraiths . Amethyst trying to find a way to defeat them stabs an emerald and finds the way to beating those things.Lady Emerald attempts a do a spell but is caught in a wind gust created by Fire Jade and Prince Garnet flies up to save her but is caught by another creature made by Fire jade.¬†
Amethyst is about to defeat¬† Fire Jade but Jade is warned by Lady Emerald just becasue Fire Jade is still her mother.But they still aren't sure if they can defeat her because she's dead.¬†
High above Prince Topaz and Lady Turqoise watch the battle with a strange man who is called White Opal Dark Opal's brother.Back on the land of Emerald the battle is done for a brief minute with Amethyst and Lady Emerald and Garnet trying to figure out what is best to do with Fire Jade. Emerald kneels by Fire Jade who revives and starts to steal Emeralds life force.Fire Jade melts the roof and Amethyst saves them all from the fall. ¬†Lady Emerald the dead one wrestles with the stalker , while Citrina tells Garnet that since he trained with the ancient ones to mind meld her and Amethyst. description:
Featuring the first appearance of Black Mask! After losing control of his company, cosmetics king Roman Sionis becomes the criminal known as Black Mask in order to take revenge. Continued in DETECTIVE COMICS (1937-2011) #553.

This issue presents the first appearance and full origin of the Black Mask!

When the heir of Janus Cosmetics is born, the doctor accidentally drops the baby, whose life is all downhill from there. From then on, something always seems off about little Roman Sionis, all the more so after he‚Äôs attacked by a rabid raccoon. In truth, Roman felt dead inside all his life, but at least tried to put on a mask of civility for his parents‚Äô high-society friends like the Waynes.

When Roman rises in the ranks of Janus, he falls under the ‚Äúspell‚Äù of a bewitching model named Circe. Shortly after Roman‚Äôs parents disapprove of the romance, they both die in a fire of mysterious circumstances. Roman inherits Janus, but soon drives the company into ruin, first with makeup designed to cover the face, then with untested waterproof makeup that causes horrible skin damage.

Circe and Janus both dump Roman, after he‚Äôs bailed out by Wayne Enterprises. For Roman, this gesture of friendship represents his greatest humiliation, causing him to ‚Äúlose face.‚Äù

Snapping completely, he destroys his parents‚Äô ebony coffins, and decides to carve a mask. Shortly thereafter, the new president of Janus Cosmetics is murdered, and the next target is Bruce Wayne.

Continued in Detective Comics #553.
name: Black Mask: Losing Face

description: A day at Gotham Zoo means balloons, cotton candy, a komodo dragon, masked gunmen and...bats.
name: ...I Went to the Animal Fair...

description: The unthinkable has happened. Harbinger, under the control of the enemy, betrayed her father figure and murdered the Monitor. Now what hope does the multiverse have for survival against the unrelenting wave of anti-matter which is destroying everything in its path?
name: Worlds in Limbo

description:
Before Jor-El discovered the Phantom Zone, Kryptonian criminals were sentenced to spend their lives in suspended animation, in orbit around Krypton. In the years since Krypton's destruction, one such villain has finally found his way to Earth. The Challengers of the Unknown arrive at the offices of the Daily Planet, looking for Jimmy Olsen. Clark Kent enters and asks if he can be of assistance. The Challengers of the Unknown are looking to contact Superman. Professor Haley tells the story of a bank executive who was poised to leap to his death from the 12th story window ledge of the bank. The Challengers of the Unknown took a multi-level approach to rescuing the man. Red Ryan scaled the building, from the ground up. Ace Morgan, with Haley, piloted a helicopter. Rocky Davis went to the window, and tried to talk the executive off the ledge. Davis held the executive's attention, while Ryan and Morgan moved into position. Haley exited the helicopter on a rope ladder and began swinging towards the executive. With Haley dangling in front of the executive, Ryan grabs the man''s leg. Held in place by Ryan, the executive is dragged back inside the building by Davis. However, once inside, a police officer inquires about a strange card left in the man's office. Upon seeing the card, the executive leaps, in terror, out the window, dislodging Ryan from the wall. Ryan quickly grabs a hold of Haley's legs, and both men work their way back inside the helicopter.

As the card is etched with a Kryptonian symbol, the Challengers of the Unknown are in need of Superman's assistance to solve the mystery. Seeing the symbol on the card, Kent, as Superman, heads to his Fortress of Solitude to probe his memories. The card belonged to the criminal, Zo-Mar. With it, Zo-Mar was able to enslave the minds of any who saw the symbol. General Dru-Zod was able to wrest the card from Zo-Mar's grasp, ending Zo-Mar's siege of Fort Rozz. Zo-Mar was sentenced to a lifetime in incarceration, placed in suspended animation, then launched into orbit. Superman carries the Challengers of the Unknown to the card's origin point on earth. There he encounters Zo-Mar, who uses the card to enslave the Man of Steel. The Challengers of the Unknown, as it turns out, have been in thrall to Zo-Mar the entire time. Zo-Mar demands Superman reveal the secret of his powers on Earth. Superman informs Zo-Mar that his powers are a result of his exposure to the sun's yellow rays. He has no idea why Zo-Mar, a fellow Kryptonian, shows no evidence of possessing the same powers. Believing Superman to be lying, Zo-Mar orders the Man of Steel to destroy a nearby town. Superman is helpless to resist Zo-Mar's commands, and sets about destroying the town. Using his power of super-ventriloquism, Superman issues commands to the Challengers of the Unknown in Zo-mar's voice.

The Challengers of the Unknown are ordered to attack Zo-Mar, and also to refuse any commands that come directly from him. Attacking from all sides, the Challengers of the Unknown are able to overpower Zo-Mar, as Davis wrests the card away from him. With the card in Davis' possession, Zo-Mar's hold over Superman and the Challengers of the Unknown is broken. Suddenly, Zo-Mar's Kryptonian powers manifest. Superman surmises that, in some way, the card must have been preventing Zo-Mar from developing powers under Earth's yellow sun. Superman and Zo-Mar battle it out in the sky, above the Challengers of the Unknown. Zo-Mar begins firing bursts of energy from his hands, a power Superman has never possessed. Superman uses his super-breath to draw the card from Davis' hand. Superman then blows the card towards Zo-Mar. The moment Zo-Mar touches the card his powers vanish. Superman, moving at super-speed, punches Zo-Mar into unconsciousness before he can use the card to enslave the Man of Steel once more. Zo-Mar awakens in the Phantom Zone, where he is greeted by Jax-Ur and, surprisingly, Zod. The Challengers of the Unknown return to the Daily Planet offices, and again inquire about contacting Jimmy Olsen. Once again, Kent enters the room and asks if he can be of assistance. The Challengers of the Unknown are looking to contact Superman again, to clear up some questions they have regarding Superman's battle with Zo-Mar. Kent challenges them to find their unknown answers on their own.

Notes:

  • Pencillers Jack Kirby (pages 1-2 & 10-24) and Alex Toth (pages 3-9).
name: Give Me Power...Give Me Your World!
How Close to Me My Killer?

description:
Captain Invincible hands the Flash a miniature camera, which has captured incontrovertible proof, that Professor Zoom is back from the dead. At police headquarters, the film is developed, and the Flash is taken aback at the photographic evidence before his eyes. The jurors in the Flash's murder trial deliberate the case, striving for a verdict. The seeming disappearance of the Mirror Master, the Weather Wizard, and Captain Cold makes the evening news. The Flash awaits the verdict with his parents, Doctor Henry and Nora Allen.

Police Captain Darryl Frye, meets with the Flash's defense attorney, Cecile Horton. Frye tries to convince Horton that the Reverse Flash is back from the dead. Captain Boomerang, fleeing the scene of his latest robbery, is taken out by Professor Zoom. The jurors cast their votes. The Rainbow Raider, fleeing the scene of his latest art theft, is taken out by Professor Zoom. The jurors are deadlocked. Half of them believe the Flash is innocent. The other half believe the Flash is guilty. Frye shows Horton that all the information, regarding the Flash's Rogues Gallery, has been erased from the police data base.

Dissatisfied with his fellow jurors inability to see the truth, Nathan Newbury, takes them all back, in time, to the day the Flash killed Professor Zoom. The jurors bear witness to the very crime they have been tasked with judging. Newbury reveals the Flash's secret identity to the jurors, that of police forensics scientist, Barry Allen. With a deeper understanding of the Flash's state of mind, the jurors unanimously come to the conclusion that the Flash is innocent. En route back to the present, Newbury, and the jurors, are accosted by Professor Zoom.

Pulling out a magic wand, Professor Zoom dispatches Newbury, then takes his place among the jurors. "Newbury", using the magic wand, mesmerizes the other jurors, forcing them to declare the Flash guilty of murdering the Reverse Flash.The Flash is summoned to the courthouse, for the reading of the verdict. Acting as the foreman of the jury, "Newbury" declares the Flash guilty as charged.
name: The Final Verdict!

description:
Professor Stein visits Vandemeer University. He meets Dr. Emily Rice, the Dean of the University, who tells him of a recent series of murders on campus. Cliff spreads a rumor that Ronnie cheated on his final exams. The Weasel attacks Professor Stein in his hotel room.

Firestorm826's Panel-by-Panel Story Summary (Spoiler Alert)

Steeltown, (a.k.a. Pittsburgh). Dusk. Dusk brings shadows, deep and dark. He likes the dark times the best. At night, the campus of Vandemeer University is like some medieval enclave whose citizens have fled the Black Death. Its twisted streets are deserted, its darkened buildings grim and lonely as any gothic cathedral. He likes it this way. He feels at home in the gloom. He smiles in the shadows. Let them wonder. Let them fear. Fear is his protector. No one knows he is here‚Ä¶none yet, though there are those who suspect. Fear is his friend!

Professor Martin Stein walks along the sidewalk of the quiet campus. A car pulls up alongside him. The driver rolls down the window, calling out, ‚ÄúMartin! Martin Stein! Welcome to Vandemeer!‚Äù Stein walks over as the driver parks and gets out to greet him. ‚ÄúSo this is the University? I was beginning to think I‚Äôd gotten lost‚Ä¶‚Äù Stein says, ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never seen a campus so deserted at night. School must have changed quite a bit since my days at Stanford.‚Äù He reaches his hand out, asking, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre‚Ä¶?‚Äù The woman takes his hand and shakes it warmly. ‚ÄúDr. Emily Rice, I‚Äôm Dean here,‚Äù she explains, ‚ÄúYou may not recall, we met about ten years ago‚Ä¶a symposium in Washington‚Ä¶‚Äù Stein smiles and nods at her. ‚ÄúOf course I remember you. That was quite a weekend,‚Äù he recalls, adding, ‚ÄúThanks for recommending me to the University Board - - a teaching professorship is exactly what I‚Ä¶‚Äù Dr. Rice interjects anxiously, ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt mind, Martin, I‚Äôd like to get off the street.‚Äù

She invites him to get into her car and they take their. ‚Äú‚ÄôOff the street‚Ä¶?‚Äô‚Äù Stein asks curiously. Concern flashes across her face as he looks at him. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt expect you until tomorrow,‚Äù Dr. Rice explains, ‚ÄúOtherwise I would have met you at the train station. The campus isn‚Äôt safe after dark, Martin.‚Äù She puts the car in gear and they drive off. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre joking‚Ä¶‚Äù Stein says, a bit confused by the ominous news. ‚ÄúI wish I were,‚Äù Dr. Rice says sadly, ‚ÄúIn the past three weeks, we‚Äôve had four killings on campus‚Ä¶the last only six days ago.‚Äù Stein gasps and asks, ‚ÄúA pattern killer‚Ä¶Some kind of psychopath?‚Äù Dr. Rice shakes her head slowly, letting out a worried sigh. ‚ÄúYou know, I almost wish it were a psychopath,‚Äù she continues, ‚ÄúBut I think it‚Äôs something much worse, Martin‚Ä¶something not quite human‚Ä¶‚Äù Far off in the shadows, the reflection of Dr. Rice‚Äôs car moves slowly‚Ä¶reflected in the eyes of something‚Ä¶not quite human‚Ä¶

Silence lies between them like a wedge during the short drive to a modest house five blocks from campus. Twice on the way, Emily Rice seems about to speak, but each time she swallows her words. Her face is shadowed with worry‚Ä¶and it is only after they reach the welcoming light of her home that the silence between them gives way, as if breaking of its own weight‚Ä¶

‚ÄúWell‚Ä¶You must think I‚Äôm some kind of lunatic‚Ä¶acting the way I am, talking about killers on campus‚Ä¶‚Äù Dr. Rice says, reaching to turn on a light as they walk into her living room. She sits exhaustedly on her couch, her mind burdened by the mysterious and dangerous threat stalking the campus. ‚ÄúNo, not at all, Emily,‚Äù Professor Stein answers, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre upset, I can see that. And from what I remember of our meeting in Washington, you‚Äôre not the sort of person given to needless hysteria.‚Äù He sits opposite her on a couch. A coffee table filled with a busy collection of books, charts, projects, and research papers sits between them. ‚ÄúSo, if you‚Äôre troubled, I believe you have a reason to be troubled. Tell me about it,‚Äù Stein continues reassuringly. Dr. Rice hangs her forehead in her hand. She takes a deep breath, letting out a heavy sigh.

‚ÄúWhere to start?‚Äù she begins, explaining, ‚ÄúArnie Lintel, he was the first‚Ä¶Three weeks ago. He was the head of our Engineering Department, a nice man‚Ä¶Santa Claus without the beard. He didn‚Äôt have an enemy in the world.‚Äù She covers her eyes to hide the tears welling up inside them. ‚ÄúThree weeks ago this day, some kids from the football team found Arnie on the practice field‚Ä¶torn to pieces. Like a rag doll with his stuffing torn out,‚Äù she recalls. Stein leans forward toward her, listening carefully. ‚ÄúFive days later, Linda Walters died‚Ä¶An instructor in music, middle-aged, nondescript‚Ä¶Nobody was quite sure where she lived,‚Äù Dr. Rice continues, ‚ÄúA lonely woman. The kind you wish you‚Äôd gotten to know better‚Ä¶afterward. The janitorial staff found her in Fastner Hall, under the basement stairs‚Ä¶in the furnace room‚Ä¶and at the bottom of the main elevator shaft.‚Äù

She runs a trembling hand through her hair and stands. ‚ÄúPeter Banks was the next‚Ä¶A professor of physics, one of the people you would have been working with. Not a particularly pleasant man, arrogant, childish‚Ä¶but brilliant. What happened to him‚Ä¶I can‚Äôt even describe it.‚Äù She stares sadly down at the floor. ‚ÄúAnd then there was Chuck Gherkin, our nightwatchman‚Ä¶Six days ago, in the Administration Building. He was just a rent-a-cop, not even part of the regular campus security‚Ä¶Someone we‚Äôd hired since the killings started,‚Äù she explains, ‚ÄúThe police think he was killed by a wild animal of some kind‚Ä¶he and the other three‚Ä¶But what animal could have done what was done to Peter Banks? What animal could be so cruel and sadistic? What animal but man‚Ä¶?‚Äù

Professor Stein walks over to her. ‚ÄúEmily,‚Äù he says, reaching a hand to touch her shoulder, ‚Äúdon‚Äôt you think‚Ä¶‚Äù Dr. Rice flinches at his touch. ‚ÄúPlease‚Ä¶don‚Äôt touch me,‚Äù she says, stepping away nervously, ‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt had a good night‚Äôs sleep since this began. I don‚Äôt want to be touched.‚Äù Stein pulls his hand back abruptly. ‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù he says softly. She reaches for the phone on the wall and starts dialing. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs nothing personal,‚Äù she replies, ‚ÄúI‚Äôd better get you a cab to your hotel. I‚Äôve told you all this because I thought it only fair you understand the situation here, before you take the position we‚Äôve offered you in our Physics Department. Under the circumstances, if you want to refuse our offer‚Ä¶‚Äù Stein shakes his head, answering, ‚ÄúNo, I‚Äôll stay, if you‚Äôll have me. Perhaps I can help.‚Äù She begins speaking to the taxi cab dispatcher. Stein rubs his chin in thought. ‚ÄúIf not as Martin Stein, then perhaps as part of the composite persona, Firestorm,‚Äù he thinks quietly. A shadowy figure perches in the darkness, staring into Dr. Rice‚Äôs window from a rooftop across the street. The moonlight reflects in its cat-like eyes. It opens its mouth slightly, and its fangs gleam and glisten as it stares intently‚Ä¶

The Big Apple, (a.k.a. New York, New York). Night. Ronnie Raymond and Doreen Day dance together in a crowded nightclub. The dance floor is packed with energetic people. The music thunders across the floor and sparkling lights blink and shine around the room. Doreen says something to Ronnie, but the music drowns out her words. They lean close to each other and decide to step away to a table overlooking the dance floor in a slightly quieter area. Doreen leads Ronnie by the hand up the stairs. Cliff Carmichael sits across the room, watching them. ‚ÄúWhat does Doreen see in that creep Raymond?‚Äù he sighs jealously, ‚ÄúThe way he‚Äôs treated her, you‚Äôd think she‚Äôd rather date a plague virus. But she won‚Äôt even look at another guy when Ronnie Raymond‚Äôs around‚Ä¶not even me! God, I hate that guy.‚Äù

Doreen sits at a table, leading Ronnie to the spot next to her. The dance floor continues buzzing with activity below them. ‚Äú‚Ä¶loud can‚Äôt hear what you - - Hey! Is this better, or what?‚Äù Doreen says, finally able to communicate over the eardrum-rumbling nightclub sound system. ‚ÄúLots,‚Äù Ronnie agrees, asking, ‚ÄúDo you want a Coke?‚Äù A nightclub waitress walks over with her notepad. ‚ÄúUncola for me,‚Äù Doreen says, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm off caffeine.‚Äù Ronnie nods at the waitress, asking, ‚ÄúMake it two, okay?‚Äù She scribbles on her pad and heads off.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe this. A couple of weeks ago, Doreen and I were nowhere,‚Äù Ronnie thinks, smiling at her, ‚Äúbut after that talk we had in the park a few days ago, we‚Äôve gotten close again. It‚Äôs like a whole new thing between us.‚Äù She wraps her arm cozily around his. ‚ÄúNickel for your thoughts,‚Äù Ronnie asks. ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it supposed to be a penny?‚Äù Doreen giggles. ‚ÄúHey, inflation,‚Äù Ronnie replies, asking, ‚ÄúHave I told you lately‚Ä¶I love you?‚Äù She leans in to kiss him. ‚ÄúMmmm‚Ä¶Not in the past five minutes,‚Äù she answers. Ronnie lays a hand on her cheek as they kiss again.

An unexpected hand suddenly breaks their mood. Tap-tap-tap! Cliff Carmichael‚Äôs index finger annoyingly pokes at Ronnie‚Äôs head. ‚ÄúKnock-knock‚Ä¶anybody home?‚Äù Cliff asks. Ronnie breaks from his lip lock with Doreen and turns to look. ‚ÄúWhat‚Ä¶?‚Äù he asks, then sighs upon recognizing Cliff. ‚ÄúCarmichael,‚Äù Ronnie groans, ‚ÄúWhat do you want, Cliff?‚Äù He stands to face Cliff, a bit annoyed at the unwanted interference. ‚ÄúAlways quick with a comeback - - eh, Raymond?‚Äù Cliff snorts, asking, ‚ÄúI thought you‚Äôd like to confirm a rumor‚Ä¶The rumor is you‚Äôre a cheat.‚Äù Ronnie looks shocked. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù he blurts out. Doreen stands up next to Ronnie, facing Cliff. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the lowest, Cliff - - even for you!‚Äù she scolds.

Cliff raises his hands, feigning innocent curiosity. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt blame me - - this word‚Äôs from a friend of mine in Principal Hapgood‚Äôs office,‚Äù Cliff continues, ‚ÄúYou scored high marks on all your final exams, Raymond‚Ä¶a whole lot higher than you ever did before. And so people are asking, ‚ÄòHow‚Äôd this jock get so smart so quick?‚Äô People like our Chem teacher. People like Principal Hapgood.‚Äù Ronnie clenches his fists in frustration, frowning. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt make too many plans for college, Raymond,‚Äù Cliff taunts, ‚ÄúCould be you won‚Äôt graduate this June, after all.‚Äù

Cliff turns and walks away, his mission accomplished. Ronnie stands dejectedly, stinging from the accusation. ‚ÄúDamn! Just when things were finally breaking my way!‚Äù he frets to Doreen. She rubs his arm, looking him closely in the eye. ‚ÄúRonnie, what Cliff said,‚Äù she worriedly asks, ‚ÄúIt isn‚Äôt true, is it?‚Äù Ronnie looks surprised. ‚ÄúHuh?‚Äù he stammers. Doreen quickly reaches a shushing finger up to his lips. ‚ÄúNo. Don‚Äôt answer. I never should have asked. I know it‚Äôs not true because I know you,‚Äù she says reassuringly, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre no cheat. But, Ronnie‚Ä¶how did you improve your grades so quickly?‚Äù Ronnie turns away for a moment, staring at the floor. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs my Dad going to say when he hears this? How can I tell him? What can I tell him?‚Äù Ronnie thinks quickly. He turns back to Doreen. ‚ÄúMaybe you won‚Äôt believe this, Doreen‚Ä¶Maybe I don‚Äôt believe it myself, but the truth is‚Ä¶I don‚Äôt know. I just don‚Äôt know.‚Äù

The Daily Express, New York‚Äôs third morning newspaper, goes to bed at 7:00 p.m. every night but Saturday, when the presses begin rolling at 5:00 for the Sunday Edition. Since his promotion to City Editor, Ed Raymond has found his own bedtime falling later and later. These days, he counts himself lucky when he leaves work by 9:00. Working late, however, does have its compensations‚Ä¶

‚ÄúRaymond, wait up! You‚Äôre gonna buy me a drink!‚Äù yells out Felicity Smoak. She steps out of the Daily Express lobby to meet Ed on the snowy sidewalk. ‚ÄúMake it a hot coffee, and you‚Äôve got a deal,‚Äù Ed answers, asking, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the occasion?‚Äù Felicity holds up a large file in her hand. ‚ÄúThis‚Ä¶the papers just came back from my attorney,‚Äù she announces, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm starting my lawsuit against that nuclear creep, Firestorm.‚Äù They turn to walk together. ‚ÄúCongratulations, Felicity,‚Äù Ed replies, somewhat half-heartedly. ‚ÄúYou think I‚Äôm being vindictive, don‚Äôt you?‚Äù Felicity asks, ‚ÄúI can hear it in your voice. Ed, before Firestorm came into my life, I owned a profitable computer software company. We were moving up - - until Firestorm accidentally magnetized our computer chip memory banks and wiped out months of effort.‚Äù

Ed listens, then suggests, ‚Äú‚ÄôAccidentally‚Äô - - your word, Felicity.‚Äù She thinks otherwise. ‚Äú‚ÄôMalpractice‚Äô - - that‚Äôs another word, Ed. One I‚Äôm going to stick to that creep in court,‚Äù she explains. The wind blows cold down the busy sidewalk as they make their way to the coffee shop. ‚ÄúShould make quite a story,‚Äù Ed answers, asking, ‚ÄúHow are you going to get him into court, anyway?‚Äù She smiles at him. ‚ÄúTrust me, lover, I‚Äôve got ideas. Believe me, have I got ideas.‚Äù Ed nods at her determination. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll bet you do, lover,‚Äù he replies, asking, ‚ÄúBy the way, doing anything Friday night?‚Äù She ponders for a second, then answers, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt know‚Ä¶am I?‚Äù She takes his arm as they walk along. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs somebody I‚Äôd like you to meet. My boy, Ronnie. I think you‚Äôll like him,‚Äù Ed says, ‚ÄúI know he‚Äôll like you‚Ä¶‚Äù

Pittsburgh. Hotel Sheridan. Professor Martin Stein finds his way up to his room and begins unpacking his bag. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure what to do. Obviously, as half of the Firestorm persona, I have an obligation to investigate these killings at Vandemeer,‚Äù he thinks, ‚Äúbut to be honest, I feel‚Ä¶burned-out‚Ä¶as a ‚Äòsuper-hero.‚Äô Ronnie may be the ‚Äòactive‚Äô half of our composite Firestorm persona, but my share of the ‚Äòteamwork‚Äô is no less exhausting than his.‚Äù He strips down and heads for the bathroom to take a shower. ‚ÄúThe primary difference between us is age. Ronnie is a teenager, full of energy,‚Äù Stein thinks, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a middle-aged man‚Ä¶and while I dare say I‚Äôm not yet ready for the grave, I am ready for a rest. In a way, I hoped the academic life at Vandemeer would provide that rest‚Ä¶but now it seems that was a forlorn hope at best. To quote Ross MacDonald‚Äôs Lew Archer‚Ä¶‚ÄôTrouble follows me.‚Äô Ah, well‚Ä¶‚Äù

The bathroom grows very steamy from the hot shower. ‚Äú‚Ä¶maybe I‚Äôll see things more clearly after a shower,‚Äù Stein figures, ‚Äú‚ÄôSee clearly‚Ä¶‚Äô That‚Äôs quite a jest. Without my glasses I can barely see the shower stall door.‚Äù He reaches for the sliding shower door. ‚ÄúEh?‚Äù he gasps in shock.

Martin Stein has an impression of movement, shadows in steam - - and then the world explodes before him. Fragments of glass batter his skin like hailstones, drawing blood. His feet slip on the wet tile of the bathroom floor, as something hairy and foul smashes into his chest. He barely has time to register shock - - as fingers tipped with claws grope for his naked throat - - and a voice like rasping steel whispers in his ear:

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been waiting for you, Stein,‚Äù the horrible beast snarls, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre the last‚Ä¶Then I‚Äôll be safe. I‚Äôll be safe.‚Äù Its powerful, muscular body has Stein pinned helplessly on the bathroom floor. It holds a claw tightly around his neck. ‚ÄúArrrrr‚Ä¶‚Äù Stein moans fearfully, wide-eyed. The beast reaches its other hand to Stein‚Äôs throat, wrapping both tightly to strangle the life from the terrified Professor. Stein reaches behind him, groping desperately. His hand locks around a metal wastebasket. He flings it down hard into the beast‚Äôs skull! WHAM! ‚ÄúUhhhh!!‚Äù the beast growls, stunned and pushed back. Stein leaps to his feet to try to escape. The beast stands, slightly stunned. ‚ÄúYou hurt me‚Ä¶hurt me!‚Äù it screeches, sprinting out of the bathroom to pursue Stein. ‚ÄúMy God‚Ä¶What is that thing?‚Äù Stein yells as he flees across the hotel room, ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt see‚Ä¶my glasses‚Ä¶the door?‚Äù He sees light ahead through his uncorrected vision and hopes it is the door to the safety of the hallway. He smacks into it‚Ä¶glass. ‚ÄúNo‚Ä¶not the door‚Ä¶the window!‚Äù he nervously discovers, ‚ÄúHeaven help m‚Ä¶‚Äù

SKRASSH! The beast slams into his body, carrying them both through the window. They fly out into the air through a rain of broken glass! They begin to fall and their bodies separate from each other in mid-air. Stein claws at the curtain flapping from his hotel window. ‚ÄúRonnie‚Ä¶have to summon Ronnie‚Ä¶transform us to Firestorm‚Ä¶!‚Äù he thinks as he wraps his left hand around the curtain, ‚ÄúCatch the curtain‚Ä¶hold myself‚Ä¶try to concentrate!‚Äù The beast grabs the other curtain, hanging in the air along the edge of the building right next to Stein. ‚ÄúJust one of you to go - - then I‚Äôm safe,‚Äù it growls. The beast pulls itself back up to the windowsill. Its dangerous claws rest on the sill just inches above Stein‚Äôs face. ‚ÄúNone of this is my fault, you see,‚Äù it tells the dangling Stein. ‚Äú‚Ä¶concentrate‚Ä¶‚Äù the Professor stammers, looking up at the beast wide-eyed and holding tightly to the curtain. ‚ÄúAll I want is to be safe. Is that so terrible? Is it? Is it?‚Äù the beast hisses. Suddenly, it kicks! KRAK! A powerful right leg snaps its foot into Stein‚Äôs head! The blow stuns Stein, and he begins to fall! ‚ÄúLord!‚Äù he yells in panic, plummeting face-first towards the street six floors below.

Months ago, Professor Martin Stein and teenager Ronnie Raymond were caught in a bizarre nuclear accident. ‚ÄúRonnie‚Ä¶‚Äù Stein thinks, trying to focus his mind as he falls toward certain doom. Far away, Ronnie Raymond and Doreen Day are locked in a tight embrace, their date night out together coming to a close. They kiss each other warmly. Under any other circumstances, Stein and Raymond would have been killed. Instead, something almost miraculous occurred. ‚Äú‚Ä¶Ronnie‚Ä¶‚Äù Stein concentrates. Doreen and Ronnie bid each other goodnight. ‚ÄúSee you tomorrow, okay?‚Äù Ronnie asks with a wave. ‚ÄúOkay!‚Äù Doreen answers back happily. A bond that was formed in that original instant of destruction and fusion, a bond which now allows either to summon the other to join in the composite persona whose nuclear powers they share‚Ä¶ ‚Äú‚Ä¶Quickly!‚Äù thinks Stein. Panicked bystanders realize what is happening above them. They look up at the falling man in abject horror. Suddenly, strange rings of light wrap around his flailing body. Simultaneously, Ronnie Raymond is encircled by nuclear energy. ‚ÄúProfessor?‚Äù Ronnie blurts in surprise.

FAAAZAAAAAM! Instantly, the falling man becomes Firestorm, the Nuclear Man! In a microsecond, Ronnie sees the sidewalk rushing up at his face. He tucks into a somersault, reverses course, and launches himself back up into the air! Bystanders gasp in amazement as he soars past them! ‚ÄúProfessor - - what‚Äôs happening - - everything‚Äôs a blur!‚Äù Ronnie asks as he levels off in flight above the street. ‚ÄúMy glasses - - still back in my hotel room - - but that‚Äôs not important, Ronald!‚Äù Stein answers quickly, explaining, ‚ÄúThere have been killings here - - four people dead - - and I believe the creature that killed them just tried to kill me!‚Äù

Ronnie flies down to the shattered hotel room window and speeds inside. ‚ÄúHere, in your room? Where is he, Professor?‚Äù Ronnie asks, hastily scanning the interior. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know, Ronald‚Ä¶He was here, but in the seconds since I summoned Firestorm‚Ä¶he‚Äôs disappeared. Undoubtedly fled,‚Äù Stein sighs. Ronnie looks around at the unfocused imagery in the room. ‚ÄúHeck, Martin, our vision‚Äôs so lousy right now, he could be squatting at our feet and I‚Äôd never know it,‚Äù he answers. Ronnie shifts a foot carefully. ‚ÄúUh‚Ä¶nope. I think,‚Äù he says, asking, ‚ÄúWhere did you put your glasses, Professor?‚Äù Stein recalls, ‚ÄúThe bathroom, I think.‚Äù Ronnie initiates the reverse transformation. ‚ÄúHold the fort a sec‚Ä¶Before we do anything, we‚Äôve gotta fix this,‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúThen I want the whole story, from scratch, okay?‚Äù

FZAAAM! One man transforms into his two separate components as Ronnie and Stein appear together in the hotel room. ‚ÄúAnd maybe you better get some clothes on,‚Äù Ronnie says, noting his friend stands in just his underwear, ‚ÄúWith all the ruckus up here, the house detective is probably on his way up - - and you‚Äôre gonna have enough to explain as it is.‚Äù Ronnie walks into the bathroom while Stein rummages through his bag for fresh clothes. Ronnie calls out to Stein, ‚ÄúHere‚Äôs your glasses. Now what‚Äôs this about a creature?‚Äù

Silently, from behind Ronnie, the beast stalks into the bathroom. A look of horror flashes across Ronnie‚Äôs face as he looks up at the mirror‚Äôs reflection of the hideous beast ready to strike! ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure, exactly,‚Äù Stein calls back as he dresses, ‚ÄúIt smelled like an animal, smelled of hair and blood‚Ä¶I was terrified, Ronald‚Äù The beast walks silently out of the bathroom behind Stein. ‚ÄúHe kept saying he had to kill me‚Ä¶to keep himself safe.‚Äù A hand reaches a familiar shape into Stein‚Äôs field of vision. He recognizes the shape as his glasses and reaches for them. ‚ÄúAh, thank you, my boy,‚Äù he smiles. He puts his glasses on and turns around. The lenses reflect‚Ä¶the beast! Blackout.

Shaker Steel Corporation, Smelting Plant #3, (temporarily closed since 1978), the hour before dawn. ‚ÄúGood, you‚Äôre awake,‚Äù the beast observes. It sits high above Ronnie and Stein on a control platform. He has bound them tightly with rope, sitting back to back on the plant floor. Huge cauldrons of molten steel hang from a massive conveyor belt above them. The beast toys with the control switches for the conveyor system on his elevated perch. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve given me so much trouble, I wanted to do something special for you‚Ä¶and I wanted you awake to enjoy it,‚Äù the beast explains to his captives. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think its fair, the way you‚Äôve treated me,‚Äù it gripes. Stein looks up, asking, ‚Äú‚Ä¶fair‚Ä¶? You‚Äôre‚Ä¶out of your‚Ä¶mind. Why all this‚Ä¶why?‚Äù The beast scowls down at him as it answers. ‚ÄúI wish I could explain, but it‚Äôs obvious you‚Äôve been out of academic life too long, Stein,‚Äù it says, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve no idea the pressure I‚Äôve been under. No idea at all. My life has been hell. All the years I spent‚Ä¶working for tenure‚Ä¶working to be safe, finally safe‚Ä¶working for a little security‚Ä¶You‚Äôve no idea what that cost me, Stein.‚Äù

The beast wraps its claw around the cauldron control and activates the conveyer. The giant cauldrons overhead lurch and start to move along in a slow, mechanical procession. The sign next to the beast warns of high-temperature danger. ‚ÄúWell, that doesn‚Äôt concern you, now does it?‚Äù the beast concludes. Its eyes gleam a menacing red. It runs its tongue around its razor-like fangs. ‚ÄúMarvelous craftsmanship in these old steel plants,‚Äù the beast says, looking around admiringly, ‚ÄúA few repairs, a few adjustments‚Ä¶They fire up so easily. I‚Äôve spent my free time here the last few weeks, fixing things. Waiting for the perfect opportunity to test my work. See how well it runs?‚Äù He points to the cauldron that has moved into position above Stein and Ronnie. ‚ÄúYou are mad,‚Äù Stein says nervously. ‚ÄúNo, Stein‚Ä¶I‚Äôm not mad, I‚Äôm the Weasel. That‚Äôs what they all called me, you know,‚Äù the Weasel answers calmly, ‚ÄúAnd I‚Ä¶I‚Äôm finally safe.‚Äù The Weasel pulls the control lever. The cauldron tips. Stein and Ronnie look up in horror as molten hot liquid steel begins to rain down on top of them!

To be continued‚Ä¶
name: Night of the Weasel

description:
1. "Macho!" written by Steve Englehart, penciled by Joe Staton, inked by Bruce Patterson, colored by Anthony Tollin and lettered by L. Lois Buhalis.
  2. "Meanwhile..." "A Day in the Life of a Cartoonist/Commuter/Executive Editor (Part III)" one page text piece by Dick Giordano.

Notes:

  • Green Arrow and Black Canary cameo appearances.
  • Letter to the editor by Kevin J. Dooley.
name: Macho!

description:
" In the end, fulfillment comes not from what we want to do--it comes from what is right to do."

-- from the teachings of Rahani

In New York City, Kamah takes Luther up to the top of a building and ties him to a hovering device, leaving him in the middle of the air as her hostage.

Back in space, the Red Saturnian forces of Jogarr have invaded the ship of Commander Synn. Synn's mother ship is the last White Saturnian ship left after what Claudius Tull did in the previous issue, so the Red Saturnians now have the numerical advantage. Jogarr and Jemm make their way to the control room where Synn is cuddling the skeletal remains of her lover, Farr. Synn shows no further desire to continue fighting and calls off her forces. After Jogarr asks her to call of Kamah as well, Synn refuses and demands that they leave. Jemm sets out to Earth alone. Before he is able to leave, Bishop Rahani asks him, "After you find the boy--will you come back to us?" Jemm looks back at the White and Red Saturnian warriors gathered around and then leaves without a word.

Back on Earth, Bouncer gets Crazy Freddie out of the rubble of Claudius Tull's house. Lincoln Mannkin and Bouncer then agree to get a place together, provided Bouncer gets a job to pay his share of the rent while Lincoln keeps going to school. The group then sets off to keep looking for Luther. After they leave, Syrra climbs out of the rubble. Her thoughts go back to her childhood friend, Jemm.

In New York City, Jemm finally arrives to rescue Luther. He engages in combat with Kamah, and is finally able to defeat her by using his gem blast to cause a car to explode and create fire which presumably kills Kamah. Lincoln drives up in a car and reunites with Luther. Several police arrive on the scene and chase Jemm away, thinking that he is one of the murderers of Senator Berkley. Luther tearfully watches as Jemm flies away.

Several weeks later, Jemm taps on Luther's bedroom window while he is asleep. Luther rushes outside and embraces his alien friend. Jemm knows that it wouldn't be right to take Luther from the home he now has, and he thinks of how he could start a home of his own with Syrra. Jemm says, "Jemm love Loo-ther!" then he flies away, leaving Luther alone in his backyard. As Jemm flies away, Luther shouts out to him, "I love you, too, Jim! Can you still hear me? I love you, too!"
name: The Final Stand

description: Six bank robbers hole up inside of a small cabin to disseminate their stolen loot. However, they decide to split their take five ways rather than six, and they shoot their partner, Struthers. Hiding beneath the floorboards of the cabin is a young girl named Cindy. Scared by the gunfire, Cindy scurries out of the house and runs into the woods. The robbers hear her running away and give chase. As Cindy narrowly evades her pursuers, she runs directly into
name: A Blaze of Glory!

description:
After departing St. Jude, in a fury, Slick Jake MacGregor encounters Amazo. The killer android bonds with MacGregor, fusing MacGregor with it's own android body. With a lull in crises, the Vixen prods Aquaman into renewing contact with his estranged wife, Mera. After their debate, the Vixen is lured away to the kitchen, by the aroma of texas chili. Dale Gunn teaches the Gypsy, and J'onn J'onzz, the Manhunter From Mars, how to prepare texas chili. A near mishap, in the kitchen, is averted by the Elongated Man.

The Elongated Man joins his wife, Sue Dibny, for a morning jog around the neighborhood. The Martian Manhunter questions the Gypsy, but receives no answers. Aquaman wrestles with the decision to renew contact with Mera. Constable Mal Parkins is murdered by Amazo/MacGregor. Giving full vent to it's/his fury, Amazo/MacGregor destroys the town of St. Jude. The Elongated Man, and Dibny, are drawn to a conflict between Paco Ramone, and Henry Heywood.

Ramone has taken umbrage at Heywood's romantic interest in Ramone's sister, Rosita. The Elongated Man quells the conflict. To appease Ramone, Heywood asks Ramone's permission to court Rosita. After giving the matter some consideration, Ramone properly introduces his sister to Heywood. The matter settled, Dibny, the Elongated Man, Heywood, and Ramone respond to a summons from the Justice League of America. Ramone reveals his new Vibe costume.

J'onn J'onzz, the Manhunter From Mars addresses the Justice League of America. Aquaman has gone missing. Amazo has attacked, and destroyed St. Jude. The Vixen suspects that Aquaman has departed, in search of Mera, but keeps this information to herself. The Justice League of America travel to the Yukon territory, in search of Amazo. The Justice League of America speculate on how Amazo escaped Superman's Fortress of Solitude.

The Elongated Man, Steel, and the Vixen each pick up possible traces of Amazo, in three different directions. The Martian Manhunter splits the Justice League of America up into four teams of two, to investigate. Gunn questions the tactics of dividing the team. Inexperienced in leadership, J'onn J'onzz, the Manhunter From Mars, is plagued with self-doubt. Amazo/MacGregor ambushes Gunn, and the Martian Manhunter, incapacitating them both. Aquaman dives beneath the surface of the sea, to seek out Mera.
name: Sea Change

description:
Timber Wolf travels to a brutal planet to fulfill Karate Kid's will.

Timber Wolf and Karate Kid's Sensei travel to the planet Lythyl to carry out the last will of Karate Kid. Along the way, they meet a young man named Myg whom the Sensei senses could train to be a hero, much like the Karate Kid. It is revealed that Karate Kid wanted Timber Wolf to plant a seed within the rocks of the rough terrain of Lythyl, completing a legend that if a plant grows on the planet, the planet would grow weak. Since that was the planet that Karate Kid's biological father, Black Dragon, turned to crime, it was important to him. Meanwhile, applicants arrive to try to join the Legion of Super-Heroes.

Notes:

  • Ranked #55 in Wizard Magazine's list of "100 Best Single Issue Comics Since You Were Born".
name: If You Think the Khunds are Cuddly, You'll Love the Lythyls

description: Jericho and Kole have come to Kole's father only to find he's been creating atrocities in the name of science. What will happen when this mad scientist turns his attentions toward the Titans? Where will Kole's loyalties fall? "Love Story" part 2.
name: Love Story Part 2

description: Finally inside the Psion temple, The Omega Men learn of the extience of the true Psion ruler.
name: Lethal Science

description: Uhura encounters a man from her past, as she, Sulu and Bearclaw infiltrate a smuggling operation, in "The D'Artagnan Three".
name: The D'Atagnan Three

description:
When Superman disavows a Daily Planet story he wrote as Clark Kent, Clark is fired! Will his closest friends stick by him through the crisis?

  1. Cover by Klaus Janson.
  2. "Clark Kent -- Fired!" written by Cary Bates, penciled by Curt Swan, inked by Al Williamson, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Gaspar.
name: Clark Kent -- Fired!

description:
A small group of costumed men hires the Fearsome Five to invade the S.T.A.R. research hospital in New York and retrieve the encapsulated form of Nuetron, a nuclear-powered villain who once fought Superman in Metropolis.

Raven‚Äôs inner battle continues. S.T.A.R. Labs is attacked as Dr. Klyburn receives a new super-powered patient. Raven intervenes and defeats the villians. However, her inner-turmoil manifests as she lashes out and causes pain to all personnel present. Gar meets Jericho and his mother at the airport. Then, he escorts Jericho to Titans Tower. Cyborg is visiting Sarah Simms at the West Side School. Four of the Fearsome Five attack Tri-State prison. Starfire, Wonder Girl and Nightwing arrive and are quickly outmatched. Dick is hurt. Kory strands Dick on a rooftop as she gives chase with Donna.

Cyborg is at S.T.A.R. Labs with Dr Klyburn preparing to have his cybernetic parts replaced. At Tri-State prison, the Fearsome Five have revealed there plan. They have come to the prison to release Jinx. They were also responsible for the earlier attack on S.T.A.R. Labs. Wonder Girl and Starfire attempt to stop the villains. However, they are quickly defeated.
name: Fearsome Five Minus One!
A Dream That Just Won't Die...

description: Mr. Monster treats the case of the horribly disfigured Mr. Scroggy. He discovers that Mr. Scroggy and other disfigured people have been to Mother Globin's show. With the help of Kelly Friday, Mr. Monster exposes Mother Globin's secret and destroys her.
The first arc of Miracleman was always known to be "...A Dream of Flying" and Dez Skinn solicited a mock cover for that title.

deck: The year is 2032. Corruption, prostitution, and cameras are everywhere; from the top of what's left of the American government to the bottom of the sleaziest pit imaginable. When former vid star Reuben Flagg is drafted into the Plexus Rangers, he's sent to Chicago, a cesspool of gang violence, dirty politics and urban warfare. It's enough to crush an ordinary man but Reuben is a survivor and with the help of his new friends, he just might be the man to put it all back together.
description:
Sherman Peabody drags Reuben to the newly rebuilt city of London to promote good will while the Plex is sponsoring a peace treaty between the English and Irish poli-clubs. So far, the only thing the two sides can agree on is a temporary cease-fire while Mark Thrust is on, and The Plex means to use that to their advantage. Meanwhile Antonio DeLa Christo, the current head of 4th World Industries, goes on a spree kill, and as usual Reuben gets caught in the middle.

This issue also contains an 8 page backup story: There Is A Heppy Land, Fur, Fur Away... by Moore and Stroman.
name: Mad Dogs and Englishmen!

deck: First Comics'adaptation of the second book in Michael Moorcock's Elric saga.
description: Elric and the rest of the Sailors arrive at a mysterious island, and seek to face the sorcerers Agak and Gagak. But in order to defeat them, the Four who are One must overcome great challenges, and even risk their own individuality.
name: The Sailor on the Seas of Fate: Part Two

volume.name: Elric: Sailor on the Seas of Fate
